Federal Agencies Use Cellphone Location Data for Immigration EnforcementByron Tau and Michelle Hackman3/5/2022

The Trump administration has been using a database that maps the movements of millions of cellphones to monitor the Mexican border and make immigration arrests, according to people familiar with the matter.

  (function() {

        headers: {

      };

    };

    /**

    function requestEntitlements() {
      performance.mark('ads-request-entitlements');
      // Get entitilements (user data)

      window.__isSnippetView = isSnippetView;

      const targeting = {
        msrc: queryParams.get('mod') || '',
        application_stack: "gcn"
      };

      if(isSnippetView) {
        const userTargeting = {
          circ: 'nonsubscriber',
          // AdTech renamed circ to usertype in data layer
          usertype: 'nonsubscriber'
        };

        window.utag_data.profiles = {
          propensity: '',
        };
        window.utag_data.user_exp = 'default';
        window.utag_data.user_ref = '';
        window.utag_data.user_tags = '';
        window.utag_data.user_type = 'nonsubscriber';
        window.utag_data.article_template = 'preview';

            experience,

      ss.rel = "stylesheet";

      function toggleMedia() {
        var defined;
        for (var i = 0; i < sheets.length; i++) {
          if (sheets[i].href && sheets[i].href.indexOf(href.trim().substr(-8)) > -1) {
            defined = true;
          }
        }
        if (defined) {
          ss.media = media || "all";
        }
        else {
          setTimeout(toggleMedia);
        }
      }

      toggleMedia();
      return ss;
    }

    window.loadCSS = loadCSS;

Journal.</p><p data-type="paragraph" class="Paragraph-sc-u5wzz1-0 cStoSw">The location data is drawn <a data-type="link" class="sharedStyles__StyledLink-sc-1id463a-0 kMEgXB">from ordinary cellphone apps</a>, including those for games, weather and e-commerce, for which the user has granted permission to log the phone’s readabilityObject.title: Federal Agencies Use Cellphone Location Data for Immigration Enforcement
readabilityObject.content:
• WSJ News Exclusive
  • Politics

Commercial database that maps movements of millions of cellphones is deployed by immigration and border authorities

By Byron Tau and Michelle Hackman

Feb. 7, 2020 7:30 am ET

WASHINGTON—The Trump administration has bought access to a commercial database that maps the movements of millions of cellphones in America and is using it for immigration and border enforcement, according to people familiar with the matter and documents reviewed by The Wall Street Journal.

The location data is drawn from ordinary cellphone apps, including those for games, weather and e-commerce, for which the user has granted permission to log the phone’s location.

We explain how such data is being gathered and sold.
